document.docAuthor: Martins, Pedro H. & Santos, Adalberto J.
document.masterDocTitle: Morphology and taxonomy of the orb-weaving spider genus Mecynogea, and a peculiar species of Argiope (Araneae, Araneidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphology and taxonomy of the orb-weaving spider genus Mecynogea, and a peculiar species of Argiope (Araneae, Araneidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Linyphia lemniscata
Walckenaer, 1841 : 263
(Name for illustration of J. Abbot (1792)
The Drawings of the Insects of
Georgia
, fig. 25. Originally deposited in The Natural History Museum, London, with photocopy in the Museum of Comparative Zoology, Harvard University, not examined).

Mecynogea lemniscata—
Levi 1980 : 13
, figs 1–15; World Spider Catalog 2017 (complete taxonomic citation history).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. This species has the widest distribution in the genus, with records from southeastern USA to northern Argentina , although with a disjunction created by the absence of records in the Amazonia. We report this species for the first time in Bolivia , and add new records from the Brazilian states of Distrito Federal , Minas Gerais , Paraná , Pernambuco , Piauí and São Paulo ( Fig. 19 ).
